results.title: Equality. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Best Films, New Jersey Public Television, Ken Stein, Paul Buck and Art Ciocco
results.brief_description: Explores the diversity of people and the breadth of the problems as one searches for “equality”. Concentrates on two basic areas, sex and race. Contains some b&w sequences.

results.title: Equal to the task
results.brief_description: This film show many of the tasks carried out by the Royal Australian Army Service Corps, including transportation, handling and supply of rations, in despatch of supplies, supply of petrol by most modern methods and training of army cooks.

results.title: Equal opportunity tapes
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Nicholas Cockram
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of equal opportunity to both male and female teachers. Tape 1. Introduces and defines the concept of equal opportunity. 2. Designed to show what the real world is about for women. 3. Attempts to encourage teachers to examine, analyse and consider altering their classroom practice.

results.title: Epstein
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper Films, Alan Harper and Henry Cooper
results.brief_description: A record of the Memorial Exhibition held in Edinburgh in 1961 of the work of Sir Jacob Epstein. Traces the development of his work and shows many of his well-known pieces - portraits of his family, of children, of many public figures, as well as his powerful symbolic figures including Lucifer, the forerunner to his St Michael on Coventry Cathedral.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Campbell Harper Films, Alan Harper and Henry Cooper

results.title: Epsilon
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Fandango, Rolf De Heer and Domenico Procacci
results.brief_description: This unusual early feature from Rolf de Heer is an intergalactic love-story between a woman from the outer space, who is sent from the planet Epsilon to pass judgment on the shameful way in which humans have mishandled their planet, and an earthbound man. Stunning land/nightscapes (the outback, great cities, and vista’s full of stars) are major characters as the two map the spaces, times and places of the heart. Cast includes Ulli Birve and Syd Brisbane.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Fandango, Rolf De Heer and Domenico Procacci

results.title: Eppalock: the first six months
results.creator_credit: Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria and Department of Agriculture
results.brief_description: The Soil Conservation Authority’s first six months work on the big Eppalock catchment project, in which the Authority is cooperating with government departments, landholders and local councils to apply soil conservation measures to the whole of an 800 square mile catchment to ensure that only pure silt free water reaches the Eppalock Reservoir.

results.title: Episode 2 [Magnetic soundtrack]
results.creator_credit: Bulmersche College of Education and Ray Twitchin
results.brief_description: An example of student film-making: a night-marish dream of events amid much statuary, with passing references to Bunuel and Cocteau. No dialogue.

results.title: Epilogue
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind and William Pettigrew
results.brief_description: From a glimpse of the beautiful planet we inhabit, as seen by astronauts in outer space, this film moves in for a closer look at what we are doing to it. The film employs the multi-image technique to contrast scenes of natural grandeur - mountains, forests, and wildflowers filmed in Canada’s national parks - with images such as the fouled rivers and despoiled countryside that result from the heedless exploitation of the natural environment. The challenge and the responsibility are plain for all to see. (Award: Teheran.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind and William Pettigrew

results.title: Epileptic seizure patterns
results.brief_description: A brief outline of the historic ideas about epilepsy and a description of modern methods of diagnosis, showing patients undergoing seizures of varying degrees of intensity, during which psychological changes are observed. The convulsions are correlated with an EEG graph.
